content: can make this pattern larger or smaller by using different yarns and hook sizes if desired special stitch definitions here you will find instructions and photo guides on how to complete a few of the different stitches v st - v_stitch this stitch round is your ​ build off round that you will connect your crocodile scale stitches onto a v st consists of 1 double_crochet st a chain 1 and 1 more double_crochet st all worked into the same st place the 1st v st in the round will always start with a chain 4 the 1st 3 chains count as your 1st double_crochet st and the 4th chain is your chain 1 see ​ photo guide to the right regarding to this round as well as where you close off the round croc st - crocodile st this stitch pattern is ​ what creates your scales you will build your scale rounds on top of the v st round previous to create a croc st scale you will chain 3 counts as 1 double_crochet st and then you will wrap around the 1st double_crochet post of your 1st v st below you will then work 4 more double_crochet sts around this double_crochet post see photo to the right for a ​ guide once you have your 1st side of the scale complete you will then anchor your scale down do this by placing a single_crochet st down between 2 double_crochet sts of the round below this will hold the scale down securely give a slight ​ tug to tighten the anchor slightly turn your pouch and you will now work 5 double_crochet sts on the 2nd double_crochet post of the same v st post you were working on this will complete your scale end off by placing a slip stitch over the chain 1 space of the next v st see photo to the right for a guide instructions us terms starting the body of the pouch ● 1st v st round chain 4 double_crochet st in the as mentioned above if you decide you want ​ same space creating 1st v st *skip 2 your pouch smaller or larger you can adjust ​ ​ sts v st in the next st* v st is 1 double_crochet chain by using a different yarn weight and hook ​ 1 1 double_crochet repeat from * to * 10 more size also keep in mind as also stated this is ​ times slip_stitch into the 3rd chain up of the worked in a medium to loose gauge approx starting chain 4 12 v sts measurements of a few sections will be listed ​ ● 1st croc st round chain 3 work 4 double_crochet at the end of certain rounds ​ sts around 1st v st post anchor with create a magic_ring/magic_ring ​ if this is single_crochet st ​ tug slightly ​ work 5 double_crochet sts not something you can easily do the around 2nd v st post slip_stitch over the alternative
